### ğŸ“‹ Title Format
Format: [Category] Brief description of the change
Guidelines:

- The category in brackets [...] should be 2-3 words describing the core improvement or modification.
- Follow with a clear, concise description of what this PR does.
- **Keep the entire title under 20 characters (same to the title of an academic paper)**

Examples:
- [New Feature] Add dark mode support for dashboard
- [New Feature] Implement real-time collaborative simulation using multi-agent system framework

âš ï¸ **However, please delete the title format guidelines in the formal version of Pull Request.**

---

### ğŸ“ Description

Briefly describe the core principle, the contributions and the problem they solve. Using `Bullet Points` format to present the core contributions as much as possible. **Do not exceed 200 words**.

Example: 

```
This PR xxxx

**Design Principles:** xxx

**Contributions:**

- ...

**Problems Solved:**

- ...

```





---

### ğŸ§ª How to Test

Describe how to verify the changes. Include setup steps and expected behavior. Please ensure the description contain 1) detailed **Steps**, 2) **Commands**, and 3) **Expected Output**, where the command can use 

```console 
python ...
```

---

### ğŸ§ª Type of Change 
 
- [ ] âœ¨ New feature (non-breaking change that adds functionality)
- [ ] ğŸ› Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] ğŸ”§ Code refactor (improves structure without changing behavior)
- [ ] ğŸš€ Performance improvement
- [ ] ğŸ“š Documentation update
- [ ] ğŸ§ª Tests added
- [ ] âŒ Breaking change (fix or feature that breaks existing functionality)

### âœ… Checklist
- [ ] Includes a detailed instruction under the `docs/`.
- [ ] Follows the project's coding style and conventions.
- [ ] Includes a self-reviewed implementation.
- [ ] Contains tests or demos that verify the fix or feature.
- [ ] Passes all existing and new tests/demos.
- [ ] Updates relevant documentation.
- [ ] Works as expected in different similar environments.
